column5: My old Normark scale finally gave up the ghost ( it was a lier from day one  ) I see the usual run of the mill brands every where like Berkely, Rapala etc, I need a reliable scale with good quality, What you good folks recommend ? Thanks in advance
I have an  brass Chatillion that I bought in the 80's that is still accurate, never even replaced the batteries once.

I have the Berkley digital fish scale from a few years back.  It's reliable.  I double checked to make sure it was accurate and it was.  The newer versions of my scale are fancier now and have more features.  I kind of like the simplicity of mine.  On/Off.  That's it.  I like the digital scales better than the deLiar versions, which I have one of as well.
